in.description: The PolEmo2.0 is a set of online reviews from medicine and hotels domains. The task is to predict the sentiment of a review. There are two separate test sets, to allow for in-domain (medicine and hotels) as well as out-of-domain (products and university) validation.
in.citation:
@inproceedings{kocon-etal-2019-multi,
title = "Multi-Level Sentiment Analysis of {P}ol{E}mo 2.0: Extended Corpus of Multi-Domain Consumer Reviews",
author = "Koco{'n}, Jan and
Mi{\l}kowski, Piotr and
Za{'s}ko-Zieli{'n}ska, Monika",
booktitle = "Proceedings of the 23rd Conference on Computational Natural Language Learning (CoNLL)",
month = nov,
year = "2019",
address = "Hong Kong, China",
publisher = "Association for Computational Linguistics",
url = "https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/K19-1092",
doi = "10.18653/v1/K19-1092",
pages = "980--991",
}
